content.description: Start up "Dominatrix"  then finish up and left. A direct start that begins left of "Dominatrix" is still waiting to be freed (probably 5.13).
content.location: Start as for Dominatrix at the top of the fixed line. The direct start is around the corner to the left.

content.description: A difficult open project still waiting a free ascent.
content.location: Begins at the thinnest part of the ledge.

content.description: Big pulls and long moves. Hard moves right off the ledge lead to a tough mantle onto a small ledge. Climb out the small roof on some easier moves to a final big move to the anchors.
content.location: The left most bolted route along the thin ledge system. The first bolted route to the right of the obvious crack corner.

content.description: Fantastic climbing up clean rock up the right margin of the wall. Lots of exposure!
content.location: Begin at the top of the fixed line at the right end of the ledge.

content.description: Climbs the obvious right facing corner system.
content.location: The obvious corner system at the end of the thin ledge.

content.description: While the left end of the wall is in the trees, the right end of the South Wall sits above a big drop-off giving several of the climbs here an additional feeling of exposure. The wall is split in two by an obvious and attractive corner crack. The climbs to the right of this offer long, involved climbing on some really fun features. The climbing here is reminiscent of nearby Shagg Crag. Exercise extreme caution while navigating the ledge system along the base of the cliff. The drop-off is very serious.
